text: hi everyone anthony fantano here the
internet's busiest music nerd
and it's time for a review of the new
veronica falls album
waiting for something to happen
veronica falls is a nice little pop
outfit from the uk
their debut lp caught my attention back
in 2011 despite the the band's style
pretty breezy pretty light but i found
veronica falls music to be more like a
breeze in the midst of january with kind
of a frosty bite to it just the perfect
amount of reverb on the guitars that
they were playing that had a nice twangy
tone to them some very ambitious and
chilly boy girl vocal harmonies and on
top of that just a touch of of english
reservation plus i was impressed with
the influences that these guys were able
to pull together not only were there
some sounds coming from that old jangle
pop style maybe a little bit of old
school indian garage rock but there were
definitely some moments that reminded me
of the velvet underground the mamas and
the papas the songs on this lp were
straightforward and featured a lot of
ear worm choruses and some of the tracks
came off maybe a little sour kind of
morbid like the song love in a graveyard
or the track the fountain there were
tracks like beachy head as well which
were pretty noisy kind of abrasive and
even though i really liked what veronica
falls had to offer on this new lp i
wasn't really sure if these guys had the
the will or the drive or the chops to
progress what they were doing here
further i guess what i ended up
expecting with this new lp was just not
that much change at all just another
heap of tracks that were endearing but
also kind of sour and dark at times too
i'm not even really sure if i got that
to me the very chilly and wintry feel of
the debut album is gone the morbid feel
of the debut album has kind of
disappeared as well and the noisier and
stranger moments like bleachy head don't
really seem to be on here as well i feel
like veronica falls has kind of stripped
away all of these elements that i feel
like gave them character and have
settled down a little bit into this kind
of one homogeneous style that is pretty
much some quaint polite indie rock and
pop with youthful boy girl vocal
harmonies i'm not really trying to sell
this record as a complete departure or
anything like that though veronica falls
still sounds like veronica falls i just
feel like they've kind of pruned the
tree a little bit and have tried to drum
together a collection of songs that are
just a bit more uniform i suppose and i
could appreciate that a band would want
to make an album that feels a little bit
more focused but i don't really think
veronica falls was all that adventurous
to begin with i mean if anything was
going to make their next lp exciting it
should have been more adventure because
there are moments on this lp where the
lack of adventure sonically and and when
it comes to songwriting too can get
pretty disheartening like the song's
teenage
waiting for something to happen and
everybody's changing where you have
moments like listen to the music you
like what do i care what's your excuse
baby there's so many moments on this
record where i kind of feel like
veronica falls is recycling chord
progressions and the melodies over them
feel so similar that i feel like i could
sing the melody from one song over
another song the only difference between
a lot of these tracks is that these
chord progressions are kind of worked
out into different keys don't get me
wrong i still like a lot of these tunes
i feel like veronica falls still brings
that really cool energy especially on a
track like teenage there are just too
many songs on this record to me that
sort of mirror each other in ways that
make me maybe slightly annoyed or just
kind of bored however there are moments
on this record where veronica falls does
try to push themselves outside of their
comfort zone a little bit and add some
extra bits of personality but maybe with
not as much success as on their debut
like the song shooting star which is one
of the most quiet moments on this entire
lp it kind of romps around very softly
very slowly but it feels kind of drab
and boring to me honestly my heart beats
though was one of the first big singles
to drop from this new lp and one of my
favorite moments on here the song really
propels itself really pushes itself has
a nice driving beat to it and the
guitars just sound so big it's really
one of the bigger tracks that veronica
falls has ever put together i'm sure
some of the lyrics on this track are
kind of corny about dreaming together
and and so on and so forth but that
sweet sentiment is is still there and
still feeling very sincere and still
feeling very real and it kind of you
know in my opinion gives the song a pass
because i get kind of sucked into this
very for me anyway very real emotion the
song everybody's changing i love the
sentiment to that track too which kind
of seems to be talking about looking
back on your past your youth even though
the songwriting melody wise and chord
wise is very basic it's very simple the
message behind the song which is about
just kind of accepting change in your
personal life i mean it just hits kind
of close to home for me not to say that
a message necessarily makes a song but a
band has to have a certain kind of
personality and sincerity to make a
message like this go over well and
that's a kind of power that veronica
falls has and the song falling out is
one of the softer ones on here i think
goes over really well and has some of
the better lyrics on the entire lp
talking about how every seat is a flower
every second's an hour it's songs like
these that have some pretty good lyrics
of fresher energy to them that actually
feel
new to me when it comes to veronica
falls writing new
new material in a lot of ways i kind of
feel like this sophomore album is again
a homogenized version of their debut lp
and and i wish that on this album
instead they spread out a little bit
more and even though i am let down by
the subtraction of variety
slightly on this new album i do think
veronica falls for the most part wrote
some decent songs in their usual style
again it's just straightforward lean
clean jangle pop whose appeal is very
apparent from first listen i'm feeling a
strong six on this new lp if you've
given it a listen what did you think of
it did you love it did you hate it why
and what do you think i should review
next anthony fantano
veronica falls
forever
